Tlaloc - Aztécký bůh deště a zemědělství, uctívaný pro dávání úrody i hrozbu bouří a sucha.  
Thunderbird - Legendární pták severoamerických kmenů, proslulý jako nadpřirozené stvoření ovládající blesky a počasí.  
Tantalus - Postava řecké mytologie, proslulá trestem věčného hladovění a žízně jako varování před rouháním.  
Theseus - Athénský hrdina, známý porážkou Minotaura a sjednocením a osvobozením obyvatel Attiky.  
Tristan - Hrdina středověké legendy, proslulý tragickým milostným příběhem s Isoldou.  
Typhon - Obří monstrum řecké mytologie, známé jako zosobnění chaosu, které ohrožovalo bohy i světový řád.  
Týr - Severský bůh války a práva, známý především pro ztrátu ruky při spoutání vlka Fenrira.  
Tiresias - Slepý věštec řecké mytologie, proslulý svými proroctvími a legendou o dočasné změně pohlaví.  
Teutates - Keltský bůh, známý z římských záznamů pro obětní praktiky a ochrannou roli vůči lidu.
Myths and Legends.U:
Unicorn - A mythical horse-like creature with a single horn, famed across cultures as a symbol of purity, rarity, and prominent in European medieval lore.
Ulysses - The Roman name for Odysseus, celebrated for his cunning and his long, adventurous voyage home in Homeric epic tradition.
Ukko - The chief Finnish god of sky and thunder, known as a creator and bringer of rain in Finnish pagan belief.
Unkulunkulu - The principal creator deity in Zulu mythology, renowned for creating humanity and establishing social order.
Ullr - A Norse god associated with archery, hunting and winter, remembered in place-names and skaldic poetry.
Uroboros - A serpent or dragon eating its own tail, famous as a symbol of cyclicality, eternity, and transformation in alchemy and myth.
Umibozu - A mysterious sea spirit of Japanese folklore, notorious for appearing at sea and capsizing ships.
Ushioni - A monstrous yokai in Japanese tales, often depicted with an ox-like head and feared for attacking people and causing disasters.
Ubar - A legendary lost Arabian city, famed as the mysterious "Atlantis of the Sands" in Middle Eastern legend and exploration lore.
Urd - One of the three Norns in Norse mythology, renowned for weaving fate and tending the world tree, Yggdrasil.
Utgard - The giant stronghold in Norse myth, best known as the realm of Utgard-Loki where gods face deceptive trials.
Ubume - A Japanese ghost of a mother who died in childbirth, widely known in folklore as a tragic spirit that haunts roads and seeks aid.
Myths and Legends.V:
Valkyrie - Iconic Norse choosers of the slain who escort heroes to Valhalla, central to Viking warrior lore.  
Vampire - Enduring folkloric undead that drain blood, shaping centuries of horror fiction and popular culture.  
Vainamoinen - A chief hero and wise singer of the Finnish Kalevala, foundational to Finnish national myth and literature.  
Vritra - Vedic dragon-serpent defeated by Indra, symbolizing the release of waters and the establishment of cosmic order.  
Varaha - The boar avatar of Vishnu who rescues the earth, a prominent motif in Hindu creation and salvation myths.  
Vishnu - Major Hindu deity whose avatars and role as preserver are central to vast mythic cycles and devotional traditions.  
Vulcan - Roman god of fire and craftsmanship, influential in myths about metallurgy and divine artisanship.  
Vanir - A faction of Norse gods associated with fertility and prosperity, notable for their war and eventual peace with the Aesir.  
Vasilisa - Russian folktale heroine famed for her cleverness and encounter with Baba Yaga, emblematic of Slavic fairy tales.  
Vodyanoy - Slavic water-spirit notorious for drowning victims and guarding waterways in Eastern European folklore.  
Voluspa - An Elder Edda poem that prophesies Norse cosmology and Ragnarok, serving as a primary source for Norse myth.  
Volund - Legendary smith (Wayland) famed across Germanic tradition for extraordinary craftsmanship and revenge tales.
Myths and Legends.Y:
Yggdrasil - Světový strom v severské mytologii, proslulý tím, že spojuje světy a je osou kosmu.  
Ymir - Prvotní obr v severských mýtech, známý tím, že z jeho těla vznikl svět i božstvo.  
Yama - Bůh smrti v hinduistické mytologii, proslulý jako soudce zemřelých a vládce podsvětí.  
Yamata-no-Orochi - Osmihlavý had v japonské mytologii, slavný bojem se hrdinou Susanoem, který jej porazil.  
Yuki-onna - Duch sněžné ženy v japonských legendách, známý svou mrazivou krásou a smrtící přítomností.  
Ys - Legendární zatopené město v bretaňských pověstech, proslulé příběhem o jeho pádu kvůli hříchům obyvatel.  
Yara-ma-yha-who - Australská aboriginská bytost, známá jako malé vampirické stvoření, které vysává a polyká oběti.  
Yaksha - Duchové a strážci v indické mytologii, známí jako ochránci pokladů a bohatství v eposech.  
Yale - Mytologická bestie ve středověkých bestiářích, známá pro své vratné rohy a použití v heraldice.  
Yali - Mytologické zvíře v jihovýchodní indické chrámové ikonografii, proslulé jako strážce a dekorativní motiv.
Myths and Legends.Z:
Zeus - Hlavní bůh řecké mytologie, proslulý svými blesky a mocí vládnout bohům a lidem.  
Zalmoxis - Trácký/dáký bůh nebo moudrý léčitel, známý díky představám o posmrtném životě a tajným kultům.  
Zmey - Slovanský drak (často Zmey Gorynych), proslulý jako mocný protivník hrdinů a symbol divokých přírodních sil.  
Zorya - Slovanské nebeské bohyně/strážkyně, známé jako ochránkyně slunce a osudu světa.  
Zashiki-warashi - Japonský domovní duch ve tvaru dítěte, proslulý tím, že přináší štěstí rodinám, kde se objevuje.  
ZhongKui - Čínský lovec démonů, slavný jako ochránce před zlými duchy a posednutím.  
Zhurong - Čínský bůh ohně, známý z mýtů o boji s jinými božstvy a zavádění ohně lidstvu.  
Zlatorog - Slovinský legendární kamzík se zlatými rohy, proslulý svou nepolapitelnou krásou a pokladem, který střeží.  
Zilant - Tatarský/baškirský dračí tvor z kazaňských pověstí, známý jako heraldický symbol města Kazaň.  
Zana - Albánská horská nymfa, známá pro svou nadpřirozenou sílu, krásu a ochranu přírody.  
Ziusudra - Sumerský hrdina potopy, proslulý tím, že přežil velkou povodeň a získal nesmrtelnost.  
Zoroaster - Zakladatel zoroastrismu, známý pro učení o boji mezi dobrem a zlem, které ovlivnilo perské náboženství.

Occupation.A: Architect - Known for designing buildings that combine functionality and aesthetics, shaping the built environment.
Occupation.B: Bankéř - Je známý svými schopnostmi řídit finance, poskytovat úvěry a ovlivňovat investiční a investiční a ekonomická rozhodnutí.
Occupation.C: Chemik - Provádí výzkum a vyvíjí nové látky, materiály a postupy, díky nimž posouvá vědu a průmysl.
Occupation.D: Doctor - They are well-known for diagnosing and treating illnesses and providing medical care to patients.
Occupation.E: Engineer - Known for applying scientific and mathematical principles to design, build, and improve structures, machines, and systems.
Occupation.F: Firefighter - Known for extinguishing fires and performing emergency rescues to protect people and property.
Occupation.G: Geologist - Studies Earth's materials and processes, and is well-known for interpreting the planet's history and locating natural resources.
Occupation.H: Historian - Known for researching, interpreting, and communicating past events to help societies understand their origins and development.
Occupation.I: Ilustrátor - Vytváří vizuální obsah pro knihy a média, známý pro schopnost vyprávět příběhy obrazem.
Occupation.J: Journalist - Known for investigating, reporting, and communicating news to the public, often holding institutions and individuals accountable.
Occupation.K: Kardiolog - Specialista na onemocnění srdce, známý schopností přesně diagnostikovat a účinně léčit srdeční choroby.
Occupation.L: Lawyer - Known for representing clients, interpreting laws, and advocating in court to secure legal outcomes.
Occupation.M: Mathematician - Known for creating and proving theories and solving abstract problems that form the foundation of science, engineering, and finance.
Occupation.N: Nurse - Nurses are well-known for delivering essential patient care, administering treatments, and serving as primary patient advocates in healthcare settings.
Occupation.O: Obchodník - Je známý svou schopností navazovat obchodní vztahy a úspěšně vyjednávat prodejní podmínky.
Occupation.P: Physician - Renowned for diagnosing and treating illnesses, physicians use medical knowledge and clinical skills to restore and maintain patients' health.
Occupation.R: Reporter - Well-known for investigating, verifying, and reporting news stories to the public.
Occupation.S: Surgeon - They are known for performing complex, life-saving operations and advancing surgical techniques.
Occupation.T: Teacher - Known for educating and shaping students' knowledge, skills, and character.
Occupation.U: Učitel - Připravuje a vede žáky a studenty, a proto je známý pro předávání znalostí a formování dovedností.
Occupation.V: Virologist - Known for studying viruses and developing methods to detect, treat, and prevent viral diseases.
Occupation.Y: Yachtsman - Known for expert sailing skills, seamanship, and competitive success in yacht racing.
Occupation.Z: Zoologist - Studies animals' behavior, physiology, and classification, contributing to scientific knowledge and conservation.

Pastry.A: Apfelstrudel - Tradiční rakouský závin z tenkého těsta plněný jablky, rozinkami a skořicí, proslulý díky své křehké, vrstvené struktuře a spojení s vídeňskou cukrářskou tradicí.
Pastry.B: Baklava - A rich, layered pastry of phyllo dough, nuts and sweet syrup, renowned across Middle Eastern and Mediterranean cuisines for its flaky texture and intense sweetness.
Pastry.C: Croissant - A flaky, buttery, crescent-shaped pastry famous for its delicate laminated layers and light, airy texture that exemplifies classic French baking.
Pastry.D: Danish - A flaky, buttery pastry made from laminated dough and often filled or topped with fruit, custard, or cream, celebrated worldwide for its delicate layers and versatility.
Pastry.E: Éclair - A classic French choux pastry filled with smooth pastry cream and topped with icing, renowned for its light, airy shell and elegant flavor combinations.
Pastry.F: Financier - A small French almond cake famed for its moist, buttery texture and iconic rectangular mold, a classic of pâtisserie.
Pastry.G: Gingerbread - A spiced sweet pastry renowned for its warm molasses-and-spice flavor and its iconic role in holiday cookies and gingerbread houses.
Pastry.H: Halva - Tradiční sladká pochoutka z rozemletého sezamu nebo slunečnicových semen, oblíbená pro svou hutnou texturu a výraznou nasládlou chuť.
Pastry.I: Ispahan - A famed macaron creation by Pierre Hermé, celebrated for its exquisite balance of rose, raspberry and lychee flavors and its influence on modern pastry.
Pastry.J: Jalebi - A spiral-shaped, deep-fried pastry soaked in sugar syrup, renowned across South Asia and the Middle East for its crisp exterior and sticky sweetness.
Pastry.K: Kouign-amann - A Breton pastry known for its laminated dough layered with butter and sugar that caramelizes into a crisp, flaky, intensely buttery treat.
Pastry.L: Lamington - Proslulý australský dezert z piškotového rýhu obaleného v čokoládě a kokosových vločkách, známý pro svou jednoduchost a výraznou chuť.
Pastry.M: Macaron - Proslulý jemnou křupavostí na povrchu a vláčným krémovým středem, často oceňovaný pro elegantní vzhled a širokou škálu příchutí.
Pastry.N: Napoleon - A classic French layered puff pastry (mille-feuille) renowned for its flaky, buttery layers and creamy custard filling.
Pastry.O: Opera - Slavný francouzský zákusek známý pro tenké vrstvy mandlového piškotu nasáklého kávovým sirupem, kávovým máslovým krémem a čokoládovou polevou.
Pastry.P: Profiterole - A classic French choux pastry filled with sweet cream and often topped with chocolate, prized for its airy texture and elegant presentation.
Pastry.R: Rugelach - A traditional Jewish pastry known for its flaky, buttery rolled dough filled with chocolate, nuts, or fruit preserves, celebrated for its rich flavor and delicate layers.
Pastry.S: Strudel - A flaky, layered pastry famed for its ultra-thin dough wrapped around sweet fillings like apple, giving a crisp, delicate texture.
Pastry.T: Tiramisu - Famous for its layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream, creating an iconic, velvety Italian dessert prized worldwide.
Pastry.U: Utap - A popular Filipino puff pastry cookie known for its light, flaky layers and sweet sugar coating, often enjoyed as a traditional pasalubong (souvenir) treat.
Pastry.V: Vacherin - A meringue-based dessert famous for its crisp shell and soft interior layered with whipped cream and fresh fruit.
Pastry.Y: Yatsuhashi - A traditional Kyoto confection flavored with cinnamon and often folded like a mochi-style pastry, famous as an iconic Japanese sweet and popular souvenir.
Pastry.Z: Zeppole - A traditional Italian fried doughnut filled with cream or ricotta, renowned especially as a traditional sweet for St. Joseph's Day.

Planet.A: None - There is no planet in the Solar System whose commonly used English name begins with the letter "A."
Planet.B: None - No officially recognized planet's name begins with B in the Solar System; only minor bodies (e.g., the asteroid Bennu) or exoplanets (e.g., Barnard's Star b) have names starting with B.
Planet.C: Ceres - The largest object in the asteroid belt and the first recognized dwarf planet, famed for its water-ice, possible subsurface ocean, and signs of past cryovolcanic activity.
Planet.D: Dagobah - A remote, swamp-covered planet in Star Wars famous for being Yoda's exile and the place where he trains Luke Skywalker.
Planet.E: Earth - The only planet known to support life, famous for its abundant liquid water, breathable atmosphere, and diverse ecosystems.
Planet.F: Fomalhautb - A controversial exoplanet candidate around the star Fomalhaut, famous for early claims of direct imaging and its association with a bright circumstellar debris disk.
Planet.G: Gliese581g - Claimed to be a potentially habitable super-Earth in the Gliese 581 system, it became famous for sparking intense debate over exoplanet detection and habitability.
Planet.H: Haumea - A dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt famous for its extremely rapid rotation that stretched it into an elongated shape and for having a ring and a family of collisional fragments.
Planet.I: Žádný - Ve Sluneční soustavě neexistuje planeta začínající na písmeno „I“.
Planet.J: Jupiter - Největší planeta Sluneční soustavy, proslulá svou obrovskou velikostí, silným gravitačním a magnetickým polem a Velkou rudou skvrnou.
Planet.K: Krypton - The fictional home planet of Superman, famous for its destruction and for being the source of Superman's powers on Earth.
Planet.L: LHS 1140 b - A nearby super-Earth in the habitable zone, well-known as a prime target for atmospheric study.
Planet.M: Mars - Known as the Red Planet, famous for its iron-oxide surface, evidence of past water, and being the prime target for exploration and potential human colonization.
Planet.N: Neptune - The eighth planet from the Sun, known for its deep blue color and some of the strongest winds in the Solar System.
Planet.O: Orcus - A large trans-Neptunian object (plutino) notable as a likely dwarf-planet candidate with a prominent moon (Vanth), making it important for studies of Kuiper Belt formation and composition.
Planet.P: Pluto - Famous for its 2006 reclassification as a dwarf planet and the 2015 New Horizons flyby that revealed its complex, icy surface.
Planet.R: Risa - A Star Trek pleasure planet famed for its hedonistic resorts, perpetual vacations, and temperate climate.
Planet.S: Saturn - Renowned for its extensive, bright ring system made of ice and rock particles that makes it the most visually striking planet.
Planet.T: Tatooine - Proslulá z Hvězdných válek jako pouštní planeta se dvěma slunci a rodný svět Luka Skywalkera.
Planet.U: Uranus - Known for its extreme axial tilt of about 98°, causing it to rotate on its side and experience extreme seasonal variations.
Planet.V: Venus - Known for its thick, toxic atmosphere and runaway greenhouse effect that makes it the hottest planet in the Solar System.
Planet.Y: Yavin - Famous for the moon Yavin IV, which served as the Rebel Alliance’s base and the site of the Battle of Yavin in Star Wars.
Planet.Z: Země - Známá jako jediná potvrzená planeta s životem a bohatou, rozmanitou biosférou.

Plant.A: Aloe - Widely known for its soothing, healing gel used in skincare and to treat burns.
Plant.B: Bamboo - Known for its extremely rapid growth and widespread use as a sustainable material for construction, textiles, and food.
Plant.C: Cactus - Renowned for its ability to store water in succulent tissues and survive harsh desert conditions.
Plant.D: Dandelion - Known as a resilient, widespread weed with bright yellow blooms and puffball seed heads, valued for its edible leaves and traditional medicinal uses.
Plant.E: Echinacea - Known for its widespread use in herbal remedies to support immune function and help relieve cold symptoms.
Plant.F: Foxglove - Known for cardiac glycosides (notably digitalis) that were developed into important heart medications despite the plant's toxicity.
Plant.G: Garlic - Renowned globally for its pungent flavor in cooking and for its traditional and studied uses as an antimicrobial and heart‑health supporting remedy.
Plant.H: Hibiscus - Known for its large, showy flowers and common use ornamentally and in herbal teas.
Plant.I: Iris - A genus of striking, colorful flowering plants widely known in horticulture for their ornamental blooms and extensive hybridization.
Plant.J: Jasmine - Renowned for its intensely fragrant flowers that are widely used in perfumery and to scent teas.
Plant.K: Kale - A nutrient-dense leafy green widely known for its high vitamins, antioxidants, and popularity in health-focused diets.
Plant.L: Lavender - Renowned for its fragrant flowers and essential oil, widely used in perfumery and aromatherapy for relaxation.
Plant.M: Moringa - A nutrient-dense tree highly regarded in nutrition and traditional medicine for its leaves' exceptional protein, vitamin, and antioxidant content and wide-ranging therapeutic uses.
Plant.N: Náprstník - Známý jako zdroj digitalisu, jeho alkaloidy se používají ve farmacii k léčbě srdečních onemocnění.
Plant.O: Orchid - Renowned for their extraordinary diversity and striking, often intricate flowers, orchids are highly prized in ornamental horticulture and the global floriculture trade.
Plant.P: Potato - A globally cultivated staple crop known for its high yields, nutritional value, and versatility in countless cuisines.
Plant.R: Rose - Widely cultivated and prized for its fragrant, showy blooms and deep cultural symbolism in gardening and floristry.
Plant.S: Slunečnice - Známá pro své velké květy a schopnost sledovat slunce, a hlavně pro semena pěstovaná na olej a krmivo.
Plant.T: Tulipán - Proslul v zahradnictví a obchodu díky pestrým květům, širokému používání jako ozdobná rostlina a historické „tulipánové bublině“ v 17. století.
Plant.U: Urtica - Stinging nettles are well-known for their painful stinging hairs and for traditional medicinal and culinary uses.
Plant.V: Vinca - Known for producing vinca alkaloids (e.g., vincristine and vinblastine) that are widely used as chemotherapy drugs.
Plant.Y: Yew - Known for producing paclitaxel, a chemotherapy drug, and for its toxic seeds and historically prized wood.
Plant.Z: Zinnia - A popular annual flower renowned for its bright, long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators.

Politician.A: Arafat - Palestinian leader, longtime chairman of the PLO and first President of the Palestinian National Authority.
Politician.B: Biden - 46th President of the United States, serving since 2021.
Politician.C: Cameron - David Cameron, former UK Prime Minister known for austerity measures and calling the 2016 Brexit referendum.
Politician.D: Dukakis - Bývalý americký politik, kandidát Demokratické strany v prezidentských volbách 1988.
Politician.E: Erdogan - Turkish president known for assertive domestic policies and an influential regional role.
Politician.F: Fidel - Cuban revolutionary and longtime leader of Cuba (1959–2008).
Politician.G: Gorbachev - Last leader of the Soviet Union who introduced perestroika and glasnost, helping to end the Cold War.
Politician.H: Havel - Czech playwright and dissident who became president after the Velvet Revolution.
Politician.I: Indira - Former Prime Minister of India, leader of the Indian National Congress, known for centralizing policies and the Emergency period.
Politician.J: Johnson - Surname of several politicians, notably Boris Johnson (former UK Prime Minister) and Lyndon B. Johnson (former US President).
Politician.K: Kaczyński - Polish politician, longtime leader of the Law and Justice (PiS) party.
Politician.L: Lula - Brazilian politician and former president, a prominent labor leader known for social programs.
Politician.M: Macron - French President since 2017, centrist leader and founder of La République En Marche.
Politician.N: Nixon - 37th President of the United States who resigned in 1974 over the Watergate scandal.
Politician.O: Obama - 44th President of the United States (2009–2017).
Politician.P: Putin - President of Russia since 1999, a dominant figure in contemporary global politics.
Politician.R: Reagan - 40th President of the United States (1981–1989), influential conservative leader
Politician.S: Sukarno - First President of Indonesia (1945–1967) and leader of its independence movement.
Politician.T: Thatcher - Margaret Thatcher was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990.
Politician.U: Ursula - President of the European Commission since 2019 and former German defence minister
Politician.V: Volodymyr - Ukrainian president who led his country during the 2022 Russian invasion.
Politician.Y: Yeltsin - First President of the Russian Federation (1991–1999), who led Russia through the post‑Soviet transition.
Politician.Z: Zelensky - President of Ukraine (since 2019), noted for his leadership during the 2022 Russian invasion.

Profession.A: Accountant - Known for ensuring accurate financial records, maintaining tax compliance, and guiding informed financial decisions.
Profession.B: Baker - Famous for crafting breads and pastries whose techniques and flavors help define local culinary traditions.
Profession.C: Chef - Known for creating, preparing, and presenting dishes that define culinary experiences and influence food culture.
Profession.D: Doktor - Známý pro diagnostiku a léčbu nemocí a zlepšování zdraví pacientů.
Profession.E: Engineer - Engineers are well-known for applying scientific and mathematical principles to design, build, and optimize systems and technologies that solve real-world problems.
Profession.F: Firefighter - Known for bravery and life-saving skills in extinguishing fires and rescuing people.
Profession.G: Geologist - Known for studying Earth's materials and processes to reconstruct planetary history and locate natural resources.
Profession.H: Historian - Well-known for researching and interpreting past events to explain and contextualize the present.
Profession.I: Inventor - Known for creating novel devices, processes, or methods that solve problems and drive technological and scientific progress.
Profession.J: Journalist - Known for investigating, reporting, and communicating news and information to the public.
Profession.K: Kinesiologist - Known for studying human movement and applying biomechanics to enhance performance and support rehabilitation.
Profession.L: Lawyer - Known for representing clients in court, interpreting laws, and providing legal advice to resolve disputes and protect rights.
Profession.M: Musician - Known for composing, performing, and shaping culture through music.
Profession.N: Nurse - Nurses are well-known for providing essential bedside care, coordinating treatments, and advocating for patients' health and comfort.
Profession.O: Oncologist - Well-known for diagnosing and treating cancer and coordinating complex therapies to improve patient outcomes.
Profession.P: Physician - Known for diagnosing and treating illnesses, and respected for their medical expertise and role in preserving patient health.
Profession.R: Radiologist - They are known for using medical imaging techniques such as X-rays, CT scans, and MRIs to diagnose and guide treatment of diseases.
Profession.S: Surgeon - Known for performing precise, often life-saving operations to treat injuries, diseases, and deformities.
Profession.T: Trenér - Známý pro schopnost zlepšovat výkony sportovců prostřednictvím tréninku, taktiky a motivace.
Profession.U: Urologist - Known for diagnosing and treating disorders of the urinary tract and male reproductive system, often using surgery and specialized procedures.
Profession.V: Veterinarian - They are well-known for diagnosing and treating animals, performing medical procedures, and promoting animal health and welfare.
Profession.Y: Yachtsman - Known for expert seamanship, navigation and competitive yacht racing, handling sailing vessels on open water.
Profession.Z: Zoologist - They are well-known for studying animal biology, behavior, and conservation, producing research that advances understanding and protects species.

Quantity.A: Acceleration - The rate of change of velocity, central to mechanics and Newton's second law (F = ma), making it fundamental for describing motion.
Quantity.B: Brightness - The perceived intensity of light from a source, widely used in optics and astronomy to compare illumination levels and classify objects.
Quantity.C: Current - Electric current is well-known because it quantifies the flow of electric charge and underpins circuit analysis and power distribution.
Quantity.D: Density - Measures mass per unit volume and is central in physics and engineering because it determines buoyancy, material identification, and many macroscopic behaviors.
Quantity.E: Energy - A fundamental physical quantity representing the capacity to do work or transfer heat, well-known because it is conserved and underlies virtually every area of physics and engineering.
Quantity.F: Force - A vector quantity that measures the interaction causing a change in an object's motion, central to Newtonian mechanics.
Quantity.G: GibbsFreeEnergy - It is the thermodynamic potential most commonly used because its change predicts spontaneity and equilibrium of reactions at constant temperature and pressure.
Quantity.H: Hubble constant - The measured rate at which the universe is expanding (in km/s/Mpc), crucial for determining cosmic age and size and notable for the persistent discrepancy between different measurement methods.
Quantity.I: Intenzita - Fyzikální veličina udávající energii nebo sílu přenesenou na jednotku (např. plocha či čas), známá pro klíčovou roli při popisu světla, zvuku a elektromagnetických jevů.
Quantity.J: Jerk - The rate of change of acceleration, notable in kinematics and engineering because it quantifies sudden changes that affect ride comfort and structural loads.
Quantity.K: Kelvin - The SI base unit of temperature, defined from absolute zero and universally used in thermodynamics and scientific measurements.
Quantity.L: Luminosity - It is well-known in astrophysics because it quantifies a star or galaxy's intrinsic energy output per unit time, enabling determination of stellar properties and distances.
Quantity.M: Mol - Základní jednotka látkového množství v chemii, známá tím, že představuje pevně daný počet částic (Avogadrova konstanta) používaný pro výpočty.
Quantity.N: Newton - The SI unit of force, widely known in mechanics for quantifying force and named after Isaac Newton whose laws form the foundation of classical mechanics.
Quantity.O: Opacity - A physical quantity measuring how much a medium absorbs or scatters radiation, crucial in astrophysics and atmospheric science for determining how transparent or opaque a material or atmosphere is.
Quantity.P: Pressure - A scalar quantity equal to force per unit area, central to fluid mechanics, thermodynamics, and many engineering applications.
Quantity.R: Resistance - A measure of opposition to electric current, fundamental in circuit analysis through Ohm's law (V = IR).
Quantity.S: Speed - A fundamental kinematic quantity measuring how quickly an object changes position over time, central to mechanics, transportation, and many applied sciences.
Quantity.T: Time - Fundamental quantity that orders events and is central to physics, from classical mechanics to thermodynamics and relativity.
Quantity.U: U-hodnota - Měří tepelný prostup konstrukcí a je ve stavebnictví známá jako klíčový ukazatel energetické účinnosti budov.
Quantity.V: Velocity - A fundamental kinematic quantity that measures the rate and direction of an object's displacement, central to describing motion and predicting trajectories.
Quantity.Y: Yield - Výtěžnost (mez kluzu) materiálu, známá protože určuje napětí, při kterém materiál přechází z elastické do plastické deformace.
Quantity.Z: Z-score - A standardized statistical measure indicating how many standard deviations an observation is from the mean, commonly used to compare values across different distributions and identify outliers.

Reptile.A: Anaconda - Renowned as one of the largest and most powerful snakes, famous for its immense size and dominance in South American waterways.
Reptile.B: Basilisk - Known for its ability to run across the surface of water, earning it the nickname "Jesus lizard."
Reptile.C: Chameleon - Known for their ability to change color and their independently mobile eyes, making them iconic among reptiles.
Reptile.D: Diplodocus - Známý sauropodní dinosaurus, proslulý svou obrovskou délkou krku a ocasu a častým vystavováním v muzeích.
Reptile.E: Eunectes - A genus of large South American anacondas, including the green anaconda, famed for being among the heaviest and most powerful snakes in the world.
Reptile.F: Frilled lizard - Known for the large extendable throat frill it flashes to deter predators and during territorial displays.
Reptile.G: Gecko - A lizard renowned for its adhesive toe pads that let it climb smooth surfaces and for its distinctive vocalizations.
Reptile.H: Harriet - A Galápagos tortoise believed to have been collected by Charles Darwin and later cared for by Steve Irwin, famous for her remarkable longevity.
Reptile.I: Iguana - A well-known large arboreal lizard often kept as a pet and recognized for its prominent crest and dewlap.
Reptile.J: Jacksonův chameleon - Malý chameleon známý třemi rohy u samců a výraznou schopností měnit barvu.
Reptile.K: Komodo - The Komodo is famous as the world's largest living lizard, renowned for its impressive size and role as an apex predator.
Reptile.L: Leatherback - The leatherback sea turtle is famous for being the largest living sea turtle and for its extraordinary long-distance oceanic migrations.
Reptile.M: Mosasaurus - A giant Cretaceous marine reptile renowned as a top ocean predator and popularized by appearances in films like Jurassic World.
Reptile.N: Nessie - The Loch Ness Monster is famed for alleged sightings and photographs suggesting a surviving plesiosaur in Scotland's Loch Ness, sparking global fascination and cryptozoology.
Reptile.O: Ophiophagus - Rod hadů, jehož nejznámějším druhem je královská kobra (Ophiophagus hannah), proslulá svou velikostí a silným jedem.
Reptile.P: Python - A large constrictor snake famous for its impressive size and ability to subdue prey by coiling and constriction.
Reptile.R: Rango - The animated chameleon protagonist of the 2011 film "Rango", famous for its quirky personality and Johnny Depp's voice performance.
Reptile.S: Sphenodon - Živoucí tuatara z Nového Zélandu, známá jako „živoucí fosilie“ díky primitivním rysům a izolované evoluční linii.
Reptile.T: Turtle - Known for its protective shell and remarkable longevity, making it an iconic and widely recognized reptile.
Reptile.U: Uromastyx - A genus of spiny‑tailed desert lizards known for their distinctive armored tails and popularity in the pet trade for being hardy, mainly herbivorous reptiles.
Reptile.V: Velociraptor - A well-known dromaeosaurid dinosaur famous in paleontology and popular culture for its agility, sickle-shaped claw, and dramatic depiction in Jurassic Park.
Reptile.Y: Yellow anaconda - A large semi-aquatic South American constrictor known for its impressive size and powerful swimming ability.
Reptile.Z: Zilla - The nickname given to the 1998 Godzilla film's giant reptile, famous for its controversial redesign and lasting impact on the franchise.

Retail Chain.A: Aldi - Known for its no-frills, low-cost grocery model, heavy use of private-label products, and efficient operations that keep prices consistently low.

Scientist.A: Archimedes - Known for formulating the principle of buoyancy (Archimedes' principle) and making foundational contributions to geometry and mechanics.
Scientist.B: Bohr - Proposed the Bohr model of the atom and made foundational contributions to the development of quantum mechanics.
Scientist.C: Curie - Pioneered the study of radioactivity, discovering the elements polonium and radium and earning Nobel Prizes in Physics and Chemistry.
Scientist.D: Darwin - Autor teorie evoluce přírodním výběrem, která zásadně změnila pochopení původu druhů.
Scientist.E: Einstein - Known for developing the theory of relativity and the mass–energy equivalence formula E=mc², which revolutionized modern physics.
Scientist.F: Fleming - Discovered penicillin, the first effective antibiotic, which fundamentally changed medical care.
Scientist.G: Galileo - He pioneered modern observational astronomy and supported heliocentrism through telescopic discoveries such as the moons of Jupiter.
Scientist.H: Hawking - Known for his prediction that black holes emit radiation (Hawking radiation) and for his significant contributions to cosmology.
Scientist.I: IbnSina - A Persian physician and philosopher, whose encyclopedic Canon of Medicine summarized the medical knowledge of the time and influenced medical education for centuries.
Scientist.J: Joule - Demonstrated the mechanical equivalent of heat and helped establish the first law of thermodynamics.
Scientist.K: Kepler - Johannes Kepler formulated the three laws of planetary motion, showing that planets follow elliptical orbits and laying the foundations of celestial mechanics.
Scientist.L: Lavoisier - Known as the father of modern chemistry due to the introduction of systematic naming and the explanation of the role of oxygen in combustion.
Scientist.M: Mendel - He established the foundational laws of inheritance through pea-plant experiments, founding classical genetics.
Scientist.N: Newton - Formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation, and developed calculus, laying the foundations of classical physics.
Scientist.O: Oppenheimer - Led the scientific development of the atomic bomb as scientific director of the Manhattan Project.
Scientist.P: Pasteur - He is known for pioneering germ theory, inventing pasteurization, and developing vaccines that transformed medicine.
Scientist.R: Rutherford - He is known for discovering the atomic nucleus through his gold-foil experiment and for founding much of modern nuclear physics.
Scientist.S: Schrödinger - Formulated the wave equation central to quantum mechanics and proposed the "Schrödinger's cat" thought experiment illustrating quantum superposition.
Scientist.T: Turing - Known for founding theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence and for his crucial work on breaking the Enigma code during World War II.
Scientist.U: Urey - Nobel Prize-winning chemist who discovered deuterium and pioneered studies in cosmochemistry and the origin of life.
Scientist.V: Volta - Invented the voltaic pile, the first chemical battery, which pioneered the practical generation of electrical current.
Scientist.Y: Yalow - Nobel Prize–winning medical physicist who developed the radioimmunoassay technique, transforming hormone measurement and diagnostic medicine.
Scientist.Z: Zwicky - Astronomer who first inferred the existence of dark matter from galaxy cluster dynamics and pioneered studies of supernovae and compact objects.
